description: First time here and the pizza and service we received is not what the other reviews are saying.  Give them a shot!  Great pizza and great service!
author: Daisy A.

description:
I've never seen such awful reviews before and had I checked sooner I probably would have dodged this place but least I can add to the sentiment having experienced it myself. 

Yes, it's a long wait. I placed a to go order (large mixed pizza, 1/2 quart spaghetti 1/2 quart spinach ravioli, tossed salad, and garlic bread) and instead of waiting the proposed 30 minutes it took an hour. 

Yes, it was overpriced for the quality. The pizza looked good but tasted bland. The tossed salad was a handful of poorly cut lettuce, along with matching pieces of tomato, and a ton of olives. The garlic break was extremely burnt and hard/broke to eat. The spaghetti was soggy and tasted like aluminum. The ravioli was the best part and tasted better than it looked. Our total was $50. Way too much.

The lady working there was nice and appeared to be trying her best to rush the order. I don't understand how the place can handle a busy night when just one customer took an hour. 

Overall, I won't be back and I won't recommend trying this place out. I give this 2 stars instead of 1 because like I said, the lady was nice to me and the venue itself looked pretty decent. Place just has a long way to go to start satisfying customers.
author: Kristy F.

description: I'm sad to say I will never return to this place. You'll know why the moment you swing open the door.
author: John C.

description: Sad! Absolutely sad! I walk in this restaurant and it looks like it something that would appear on Gordon Ramsey's show Kitchen Nightmares. Where do I start??? HM! maybe when I asked for a water and she gave me a bottle of arrowhead water AND CHARGED ME $1.50 for it! Not only was I mad about the price, but ARROWHEAD. The nastiest bottled water ever. But after ordering THE STAR FLEET PIZZA, I realized I wasn't on a television show...I was in hell. Hell. This pile of greased was literally dripping and oozing from the za getting all over my new trousers. After eating a slice, I called it quits and pulled the trigger in the bathroom. And no, it was not time to rally after. So once I check out she swiped my card and there was only three options to tip: No tip, 18%, or 25%. And she was HOVERING over me while I decide pressuring me to just click 18% and gtfo of there. Taraval was cool in the 50s, but gawd damn it's over! Go check out gentle cuts for a fresh fade!
author: Matthew K.

description:
This was the place of my childhood. When you entered the place you'd be met by the loud hustle and bustle of happy families enjoying dinner! The kids would be watching pizza being made in the front and you could even get a handful of pizza dough to play with! That was THE BEST! The wait for a table would be long and there were times we even avoided the place because it was so crowded. I've had so many fond memories playing with my friends here after a game or for birthday parties! 

I came in today and was quickly heartbroken at how it looks now. The place is falling apart. It was completely empty. There were holes in the ceiling and junk in the back. The oven was off and it just looked so lonely in there, the magic of the 80s and 90s gone. Only a mere shell left. 

The lady who ran the place was quite warm and friendly though! She treated us like we were guests at her house. She was the only one there.

But because she was the only one there (and another party had arrived) our food took forever. 

And when it came it was completely burnt underneath. This made me soooo disappointed. The nice lady offered to take 10% off our bill. But we were only able to eat half of the pizza. I literally SCRAPED the toppings off the crust. I normally wouldn't even eat it but I'm SUPER pregnant and I was sooo hungry! 

I just have to leave my beautiful memories of this place in the past.
author: RACHELLE T.

description: Great Greek salad and delicious olive and mushroom pie .  Friendly staff and prompt service!  We'd come back !
author: Davif G.

description: Two hours for a delivery and my order still hasn't arrived? Expecting a full refund. This is ridiculous.
author: Jacqualyn P.

description: The best pizza and wine in the neighborhood! Love this place. It's our go to for great pizza! They also have a cute patio in the back of you want to hang out with friends and family.
author: Flora K.

description: Been coming here since both my boys attended St Gabriels in the early 90's! One thing for sure the pizza is consistently yummy!! We always order the Pirro's Special which has everything we'd love in a pizza!
author: Danton M.

description: Big success on your pizza today for my daughter 4yr old birthday party. Thank You Pirro's
author: Ben L.

description: Simply the best pizza in San Francisco...and has been for decades.  Word to the wise about San Francisco Restaurant reviews...I'm a third generation native on both sides of my family.  When you research the history of a given restaurant and it's like Pirro's - over 30 years old and it gets bad reviews....99% of the time it's from insecure newbees trying to sabotage the established SF restaurants.  They take the low road and that's unfortunate..and common...i.e. the lineage and longevity of a restaurant determines its quality...not reviews....happy eating to all.
author: Freya M.

description: Living in this neighborhood all these years, I remember each year around my birthday I would dream about coming here for pizza. These were years I say I didn't have much of anything. Give me a Costco pizza back then and I would had thought that was the best present ever.. And that's what I knew about food.
author: M C.

description: Really nice, cozy place (but not too small--they've got a back patio area that I've seen them use for larger groups) with underrated pizza that has a perfect wood-fired taste to it. Classic, delicious pizza that really doesn't need to be anything but straight-up pizza.
author: AJ P.

description: One of the best places I've ever stopped in to! I'm pretty sure the owner was our server, chef, host, cashier... Well you get it.. All of the above! Amazing. I can't understand why this place didn't have a line out the door. We ordered a cheese pizza and a pitcher of beer for three people and still were treated like royalty. Wouldn't pick anywhere else on the block!!!!
author: Anna G.

description:
The woman who delivered my burger at 11:30pm must not know how to read - either that, or she is terrible at following instructions. 

It was past 10:30 at night when I was really craving a burger and decided to order from Pirro's Pizzeria through Eat24. Because it was past 10:30pm, when most people in a household are trying to sleep, my instructions were to call my cell phone instead of ringing the doorbell. What happens? The delivery woman rings the doorbell. In addition to not being able to follow instructions properly, she was also impatient. When I walked out of my door to meet her at the gate, all I heard was "MAAAARK!!!! MAAAAAAARKKK!!!!!!" at the top of her lungs!!!

Lady, are you freaking kidding me??? I am deducting one star for your lack of customer service, another star for your lack of professionalism, and another star for your inability to follow very basic instructions - instructions that were there as a courtesy to the rest of the people living in my house. 

Aside from the obnoxious delivery woman, my burger was actually pretty decent. Is it the best burger in San Francisco? No. Does it hit the spot when you're craving a burger at 11pm? Yes. Would I order from them again? Definitely. Am I hoping for the same delivery woman? Yes, so that if she pulls that crap again, I can give her a piece of my mind.
author: Mark B.

description:
I don't even know where to begin. This pizza was so bad, that I wish I could've thrown it all up after I ate it. My boyfriend and I were hungry, and it was the only place open on Christmas Eve. We walked in and was greeted by the waitress, who I might also add, is the chef, cashier, and hostess. We ordered the Pirro's special pizza and waited about 30 minutes for the pizza to come out. As we waited, we saw horrifying things that a customer should never have to see:

1. The customers next to us ordered buffalo wing appetizers, and we saw the chef/ waitress/ cashier open a Tyson's chicken bag and heat up the appetizers.

2. Then, we saw her wear her gloves that she used to touch the food to carry out drinks and menus to new customers.

3. She then continued to wear these gloves in her many ventures to serve food and pour beer.

She finally served us the pizza and the cheese was so rubbery, we could barely separate the pieces. The first time I will ever see my boyfriend, the biggest pizza fanatic, leave pizza uneaten. By far, the WORST place i have ever visited.

Do not ever walk in here even if it is the only place open in all of San Francisco.
author: Julie Y.

description:
Had the Pirro's Special tonight.  I thought it was good.  The crust is thinner than North Beach's and seemed thicker than Brother's.  Good for its niche.  Plenty of toppings.  The mini (8") was a good size for one person.

I went around 8pm, it was pretty quiet.  Just one or two other tables of people there.  Retiree gentlemen, I think.  The owner(?) woman seemed nice.  She was the only one working there at that hour.  They had a tv on showing a 20/20 type show.

The place was pretty big.  There seemed to be seating outside in the back, but I didn't check.

I'd seen Pirro's for decades, whenever I pass by on Taraval street.  Always wanted to try it, so finally did.  It was about what I expected.

I would return with some friends, if we were hanging out in the middle stretch of Taraval.

Closes at 10pm on Sundays.

Minus one star, because the pizza price was around $3 more than was listed on their website.
author: Joseph B.

description:
I have not written a response on here in quite some time but this lady struck a cord with how careless and matter of fact she was. At first the lady was nice enough when I came in. I ordered a med vegetarian pizza and a beer 15 bucks plus a beer no problem. I told her I didn't like olives so SHE SUGGESTED ZUCCHINI. I agreed.  Never telling me there was no substitutions on specials and would be a $3 charge for said substitution (also as a caveat I ordered from their taped to go menu on the wall which does not mention there are no substitutions and again she didn't mention this). When I got my bill I was shocked. I tried to explain that if I had ordered a large vegetarian special it would Still be LESS than the increased cost for the substituted one veggie on a medium. (Only 2.50 to go from med to large and 3.00 to add zucchini I place of olives.) She flatly said that's how we do it here. 

I will fairly say the pizza was fine but the crust was flavorless a little salt or garlic would make the difference. I did get what was suggested and I agreed to buy definitely not 3 bucks worth of
Zucchini. But hey I'll never pay for it again and will not go back here even with a coupon.
author: John D.

description:
Oh, this place used to be soooo good back in the day.

I worked here in the 80's during high school, and i remember how the pizza was - what it tasted like, how it was made, etc..  Regrettably,the philosophy of how to make a pizza has changed far for the worse - as these reviews reflect.

In essence, I find the flavors roughly the same - the major difference is that they no longer put any *stuff* on the pizza anymore!  When I made it, it was a true pie, it was hearty, it had weight and mass - I'd say now they are putting less than half of the amount of well-balanced ingredients we used to put on them.

I think this place could change its image slowly for the better if it just paid attention to making a more generous pizza for starters.  

Otherwise, this 40-year sunset institution is probably going bye-bye fairly soon if nothing changes - a business can't survive too long with this kind of online reputation i'd imagine.
author: John H.

description:
Disgusting place the waitress is the chef .
Eat the whole time she made the food I ordered to .
After watching her shove food in her mouth the whole time wiping her face .
Looked like she picked the salad out of the garbage in the back room to serve me to go .
I paid for the food but after watching her the whole time .
I did not even take the food.
The owner sat there the whole time .
I would not give that food to a dog.
The place is a dump.
Why does the health department go there and inspect.
The only reason I gave it one star is the toilet works .
I guess that's because people must get sick eating in there all the time  and can flush away the evidence.
author: David R.

description:
Stopped by Pirro's for a quick bite after a long day. Good ambiance and decor in the place, kind of reminds me of pizza parlors from when I was a kid (all it needs is a video arcade with Gauntlet and Rampage to be a Shakey's from 1987). Easy parking.

They have Fat Tire, Beck's, Carlsberg, Heineken, Bud, Fosters and Sierra Nevada On tap, and you can get glasses or two sizes of pitchers. Average prices on the beer. 

The garlic bread with mozzarella was good, if a little greasy. 

Pizza took a while, and was really greasy. REALLY greasy. The flavor wasn't bad, but it needed to have a few thorough pat downs with several napkins to get it to a decent place. We had the Star Fleet (??) which had ham, pepperoni and sausage. The crust was thin, but the best part of the pie.

Overall, a bit too greasy and expensive for my tastes. Large pizza + soda + garlic bread came to $32 and some change.
author: Jonathan M.

description:
Let's begin with the paper plates.

Picture this: a sloppy yet somehow crunchy piece of pizza shoveled half an hour late onto a plate fit for a kid's birthday party, and then collectively plopped on top of a real plate -- the kind that breaks if you throw it. Which is probably what we should've done. But no, for roughly $6 a slice, we stayed and poisoned ourselves with the injustice that is an unassuming Pirro's.

It took years off my life, the lining from my stomach, and the light from my eyes.

Also, there was a cat prowling around in the back, visible through a glass door. That's all well and good, but lady, quit meowing back at it and serve me my dinner in a timely manner.

And for the record, there are few things more harrowing on a slice of pineapple pizza than pulling up a single too-big chunk of obviously canned fruit and finding no cheese or sauce beneath it. Like a sadistic checkerboard. Like the strangest, skimpiest slice in the history of the Sunset.
author: Jiordan C.

description:
Food 2/5 - It's pizza so the baseline is low cause how hard is it to make pizza good? We ordered the Mediterranean. Cardboard crust and uncooked toppings. The pie was left half eaten. Did not take home leftovers.

Service 1/5 - We were gettin' hassled to vote for Pirro's on Facebook by the lady who own's the place.  Made the evening very uncomfortable.

Atmosphere 2/5 - It's homey on the inside, but it was dead quiet when we walked in. Knew immediately that this was not going to go well, but was too much of a chicken to walk back out.

Conclusion - Will not be back and do not recommend.
author: Vivien T.

description:
This is the worst pizza in the city, which is not an easy award to win. 
The ambiance was uncomfortable, at best. The pizza took forever, even though the restaurant was nearly empty. It tasted similarly to a reheated frozen slice and it was outrageously expensive. The owners' cat that was constantly trying to get in through the back door was very unsettling. Do they let it in after hours? Do they have any idea at all how to run a pizza place? Nope! 

Also, let it be inarguably clear that "hole in the wall" is not synonymous with "good". Sometimes, the taste of the food is consistent with the taste of the atmosphere. I will absolutely never waste my money here again. Please do not encourage them to continue staying in business.
author: Jerrod M.

description:
Worst place I've eaten at period. The waitress/cashier/chef/hostess was really rude and wasn't productive at all. 2 dinner meals took 2 hours to make. Pizza was digorno grade. Best thing was the beer. She kept saying "sorry we're out of blah blah blah" NOT ONCE DID SHE TAKE AWAY DIRTY DISHES. Stating that she only has 2 hands. She's cheap for not hiring anybody to help. Raviolis do not take 2 hours to make. Speggetti and 2 meat balls do not take 2 hours to make. Chicken parmasaen ....same patties that you get from the elementary school menu for chicken patty sandwiches. She offered my kids ice cream that she quotes "melted" because the other one was too hard. They had melted ice cream with solidified  chunks. My wife told the lady the ice cream was bad and we needed new ones. At the end, we walked to the counter and requested to pay for the ice me lted ice cream and bill and she said she would not charge us for the 20$ small pizza. 65$ total. My wife began to complain about service and she eventually charged us 80+$ for everything. Nobody finished their food. NO IDEA WHY THIS PLACE IS STILL OPEN!!! Please you guys... don't go here.

Let's shut this place down for good.
author: Tommy P.

description:
I've been going there since I was an infant. My earliest memories are of my dad or my uncle lifting me up to watch them make the pizza. 

When I moved away from San Francisco I opine about their pizza on a regular basis and is one of four must got to restaurants in The City I have to visit. 

My personal favorite is extra cheese, black olive, garlic and salami. 

Please open a second place in Orange County, we need a Pirro's down here!
author: R.C. S.

description: Cool decor-very Italian style. But how the hell is this place still open?! Terrible pizza and service and price.
author: Anastasia P.

description:
Gadzooks!!! What is up with all these one-stars??? I LOVE Pirros! It's a total hole-in-the-wall which makes the place that much better! The owners are super nice and accommodating. It is a very family friendly atmosphere and the staff is personable.

About their pizza: Best crust ever! I love how it's crispy on the outside, but very thick and bready on the inside. Sauce is good and all the toppings are fresh (at least the vegetables are for this vegetarian).

This is obviously a place where locals (like myself) venture; definitely not a place for the SFSU brats with a too high sense of entitlement who have zero taste to begin with! They don't appreciate good local eateries.
author: Noemi P.

description: I will NEVER order from the place again. They were late on the delivery & the lady on the phone was very rude when I called back telling them she forgot part of our order. My boyfriend's cheeseburger looked alright. But never order the pastrami sandwich from here. What I got was two burnt pieces of toast, 2 or 3 little slices of pastrami & some weird cut up onion. I couldn't even taste the pastrami. Basically all I was eating was burnt bread. Overpriced burnt bread.
author: Jenna H.

description: If only I could give negative stars - today would be it. Ordered via Eat24. Confirmed delivery on 60 min. Ok, that's fine. 2 hours later still no pizza. Contacted eat24, they said that driver is out for delivery. Another 30 min later, making this 2:30, I get this disgusting pizza, cold, stale and smelling like Windex. Never again. Never again.
author: Laurie P.

description:
So-so pizza. Not as bad that evening as Yelp reviews had led me to brace for. However, in a city that is finally starting to throw off the "California curse" of consistently crappy pizza - this place won't be leading the charge. 

Had a "Pirro's Special," the crust wasn't terrible and the ingredients were not too bad. However it was skimpy on sauce and certain key ingredients, and the quality of ingredients didn't seem top shelf for the price paid.

I read reviews where people got sick here, this was not our experience. But would I make it a destination again? Probably not, far too many other better choices not far from here.
author: Bob M.

description:
I was hoping Eagle Pizza would be open today, but to my major disappointment, they were on vacation...so off to Pirro's (I was hoping they got a bit better after my ONE Star review many years back).

NOT...PIRRO'S IS A DISAPPOINTMENT TO PIZZA AND PASTA. I'd recommend Kitchen Impossible from Food Network to do a makeover of this place. (LIKE SERIOUSLY!!!)

Gf and I were greeted by an Asian lady who sat us down. She picked up our order quick BUT it took forever for our drinks and food to get to the table. 

FOOD: Gf ordered the ravioli dinner set (comes with soup, salad, dessert and coffee) and I had a pizza. Gf's salad (was from a package) and soup (from a can and microwaved), but the ravioli..HOLY SMOKES! 

Undercooked ravioli (it was the size of tortellini) and drizzled with Campbell's pasta sauce (we saw the can as we were leaving). It wasn't just undercooked, only the outside of the pasta was cooked. The inside was terrible! Straight up, it probably came from a package, and I wouldn't even feed my dog this crap! 

I brought up to the server's attention and we didn't get an apology or anything. Ravioli was replaced with spaghetti which at least this time the pasta was cooked but the sauce was TERRIBLE! It had the metallic canned sauce taste to it. I've been to other pizza places which make excellent sauces, but this was a total fail!

Coffee and dessert never came either. 

My pizza was mediocre, but edible. 

SERVICE: SUCKS. 

Server seemed like she didn't want to serve us. She paid more attention to the regulars and the large party that came in as we were finishing up. She paid no attention to our empty beverages until we asked for a refill. 

Don't even bother for a pizza pickup either. It seemed like people who came in to pick up a pizza had to sit down and wait at the counter too.
author: Jason C. J.

description: Car broke down. Super hungry. This place hits the spot. Corine was super awesome. There is something to be said about down home service! Very comfortable, friendly atmosphere.
author: Mark G.

description:
We came in with a group of 30 plus people. THey have an outdoor back patio. We had a couple of dogs with us. The woman in the front said we couldn't take the dogs onto the patio. One was a service dog, she still said no. We asked her to call the owner and make sure it's okay. Again it was an outdoor patio and OUR group were the only people out there, well along with piles of discarded wood and stuff, it wasn't a zen patio or anything, cheap picnic table and a lot of crap laying around.She said she wouldn't because she was TOO BUSY...now again WE WERE THE ONLY PEOPLE IN THE PLACE. She was just rude...

Also...they were out of most of the tap beer. The food pizza was okay, but lets face it, it's San Francisco, okay doesn't cut. it. And neither does attitude from the staff.
author: Jill T.

description: Went in for a personal pizza and one drink. Pizza was mediocre, service was horrible, and the lady that runs the joint charged me $25 for a PERSONAL pizza and one soda. Never going again, felt so ripped off.
author: Niti Y.

description:
I live in the neighborhood, so decided to check this place out for dinner.  There was only one other group in there besides mine -- and now I know why.  The atmosphere was very unwelcoming.  The entire place felt like it had been neglected for several years.

The service was poor and person who took our order struggled understanding English, so we had to repeat ourselves numerous times.  In fact, I was surprised that we actually ended up getting what we ordered.  The pizza was decent and the prices weren't bad, but I would have been better off just staying home and ordering delivery from Round Table.
author: Matt Y.

description: This is by far the worst pizza I've ever had, which is actually pretty phenomenal. When I dined here, not only was the pizza below the standard of Red Baron or Di Giorno, but the owner insisted that I go on Facebook and vote for her restaurant to receive a business grant. I'd almost recommend dining at Pirro's to experience just how truly horrible everything there is.
author: Matt T.

description: This place is dirty and disgusting and the owner lady is EXTREMELY rude !!!! DO NOT EAT HERE!!!
author: Hunny B.

description:
Yes people.  I just gave Pirro's 5 stars and I mean every star of it.  I was at Pirro's last night for a post baseball championship victory and the experience was damn near perfect for a party of 30.  I will start by saying that the 8 X- large pizza's we ordered were all delicious and there weren't any leftovers.  Now, acknowledging that not all pizza lovers enjoy the same kind of pizza, not all pizza restaurants will appeal to everyone right?  If you are a fan of thinner crust and don't like globs of tart pizza sauce, then you, like me will probably like Pirro's.  

As far as the overall atmosphere I agree that it can use a facelift.  But do I really care?  No.  If I wanted atomosphere, I sure as hell wouldn't drive out to the 7-11 on 32nd avenue to get it.  It was clean, nicely dim and felt kind of old school.  I can say with 100% certainty, having grown up 2 blocks away from Pirro's, it has not been updated at all since the 1980's.  But seriously, I'm not sure of all the criticism considering that it is in the middle of nowhere.  What are people expecting on 32nd and Taraval?  

Historically, the service at Pirro's has been hit or miss.  Last night it was pretty exceptional.  We did drop by before the game and talked to the owner.  So, she had warning that a team of fired up 6th grade boys were coming for a victory dinner.  She actually, started making all the pizza's in advance and began cooking them when we called from the field during the last inning.  When we arrived, she lined up all the tables in back for our party, repositioned the big screen TV and was friendly to everyone including a bunch of loud, rowdy tween boys.  Maybe she reads her reviews?  Not sure, but the service was great.  No complaints.

Lastly, for the reviewer who felt it necessary to point out the race or ethnicity of the ownership.....really?  It says a lot more about you than it does about this pizza place.  I'll put money down that you wouldn't do that if the racial background of the owners was one that you might feel intimidated by.  And I think that makes you not much better than a bully.
author: Nicole T.

description: Just gross. Service was terrible. So overpriced. Owner? The one lady working and making our salad that consisted of romaine, cheese and croutons took 20 minutes and we were the only people in the whole place. Then the pizza came another 15 minutes later, we were nauseated by the place so we took it to go. I would never come back to this place, even if I was paid to.
author: Joey M.

description: Terrible customer service and pizza was undercooked. Did not have a pleasurable experience at all, I got a pizza slice for $5. The owner says, " I'll make a fresh slice" which meant a super thin floppy piece of undercooked pizza. I do not recommend this place!!!!! #inedible #pizzafail
author: Ryan L.

description:
If gross and low-quality had a baby, I think this would be it and if I could give -5 stars I would but DARN I am forced to give a 1-star! 

Anyway, I walked in to a lady sitting at a table calculating the many receipts and papers that were scattered across. I got an expensive ($4.50) slice of sausage pizza here and my friend got a vegetarian slice ($4.50 also). I say expensive because aside from the awful taste (my tongue!!!), old dough (it was a dark grayish color) and skimpy toppings (about five little sausages), it was thin and pretty small in size. I don't even want to imagine how much whole pizzas are and how big (or in this case small) they are. After one bite I hurled it into the trash before I myself would start to hurl.

Never say never but I will never ever ever ever ever ever ever (in the words of Taylor Swift) come here again and I recommend that YOU don't either...unless you want low-quality disgusting pizza then feel free to of course! ;) Oh, and there's a $10 minimum if you want to use plastic. I got charged an extra dollar because I was only at $9. Boo! 

There were no other customers and now I know why but in all honesty, the lady that helped me was nice but the food was BLECK!
author: Hwan L.

description:
woof.
As rating goes I didn't even want to give Pirro's one star.
This was the most AWFUL over priced food i have EVER eaten.
Not to mention the service was atrocious. 
Please food eaters of San Francisco do not waste your precious time or money...you are better of going to seven 11 or better yet buying dog food down the street.
author: Becca P.

description:
Here is a sad story. I've lived in the Sunset for many decades. This place USED TO have the best pizza. It was called the Pirro's Special. It was delicious. It had the best sourdough crust, lovely fennel spiced Italian sausage, and great sauce. I saw this place slipping away because the pizza started to only be good if a certain cook was there. NOW this place has gone to hell. I knew immediately it had gone there when I ordered my Pirros special and the crust was now no longer sourdough. Also the sauce had changed, yuk. 

But check this out. It was the seventh game of the World Series so I know I'm not cooking. Game starts at 7:00pm so I call to get two large pies to be delivered. I called at about 5:00 or 5:15. The lady (Korine) takes my order, says it'll be a half hour/forty five minutes. I say perfect. So along comes 6:15,6:25, at 6:30 my boyfriend calls and asks what's up and offers to pick up the pies. She says,"Oh no, your pies are in route." We say fine. Along comes 6:45, no pies, World Series about to start. At 7:00 we call her and say what's up. She says, "you said you were picking them up blah blah blah" My boyfriend and I hop in the car and fly down there. I am hot because now I'm missing the game and my pies are sitting around getting cold. I figure she'd throw in a couple of sodas for the trouble but no. I was too mad to go in so my bfriend goes in and Korine says, loud, "what happened!?" Now she's blaming us, we are missing the game, and the pizza's cold. No apology nothing. Asks us what happened. On top of that the pizza was garbage and not cheap. That was almost $60 worth of pizza.

I tried going into the place once on a Friday night to eat in. What I saw was the final straw. Korine is the only employee there so she cooks and cashiers. She was taking money and then bare handedly making pizza. No she didn't wash her hands in between. The only people that ever go in there are a couple of old men. They always sit there at the same table and get drunk. Not very appetizing. Never again. I'm sad.
author: Hope C.

description:
my wife told me she had eaten here some years ago and she liked their pizza. 
I should have trusted my gut instincts and ran out of this place.
First clue,, mostly empty
2nd clue.. clutter all over counter at dinning room serving table.
3rd clue.. dirty dishes pilled into cart.. From lunch or nite before?
4th clue.. toilets filthy and no soap or hand towels.
Pizza was not half as good as a frozen pizza and we didnt bother to take
the unwanted left overs. We were assured it was there most popular pizza..
This places days are numbered unless they turn it around and make some changes.
our chickes taste old and the pizza greasy. the place was messy and the price expensive.
 We now joke and laugh about our worst SF meal in this place.
WE WILL NEVER RETURN
Best of luck!
author: Kraig B.

description:
Ahh walk into this pizza spot while waiting to get a table at The Spot Lounge, owner stated we were next but never gave us a timeframe, being a hungry hippo and wanting to devour anything in sight, we walked up the block and across the street to this pizza parlor. About 20min before closing, we asked the guy if he had any more slices and behold.. just 3 left :)

Ahhhh, how I smiled with joy, time for pizza! Piping hot out of the oven, fresh gooey cheese and the aroma of garlic, made me the happiest woman alive. 
*Damn when was the last time I had pizza this good??? It was foodgasmic experience, I didn't want to end after taking in each bite after the next :)
author: Anonymous P.

description:
We arrived into this place early on a sunday evening....the empty restaurant and the mess of random stuff cluttering in the reception areas should have been a dead giveaway. We had been for a long walk around the park and the beach so we thought we would eat anything given how hungry we were. I was wrong...the lady serving basically judged my friend and I by our size telling me that a small would be big enough for me and my friend should go for the medium. We laughed this off!

Then came the pizza....I ordered one with chicken and mushroom. I say mushroom because that's what it said one the menu but I highly doubt that's the ingredient used on the pizza. They did not taste nor look like mushrooms. I have never tasted a pizza like this before. I presume it had been microwaved instead of cooked in the oven as that is the only explanation for the taste or lack thereof! 

Seriously overpriced regardless of what they were serving. Fro the location and premises this was not reasonably priced. Also, paying by card there is only options to tip 20% which I did not feel was just but I had no other option. I really don;t know how they are still in business serving this excuse for food!
author: Ciara O.

description: The food is worth the wait unless you want a mini pizza those cook fast and are delicious!
author: Lizet B.

description:
Last evening, I had an appointment in the Sunset and afterward was considering crossing over to Sloat Boulevard and using a coupon at Arby's for a free value meal. Somewhere between my lusting for an Arby's Value Meal, I got a hankering for some pizza. I boarded the L Taraval and while traveling towards Thirty Sixth Avenue, I saw a sign that said pizza but, the exterior of the restaurant looked like a tavern. I allowed my curiosity to get the best of me so, I got off the LRV and decided to walk back and see what the 411 was about this place. As I approached the door, I noticed they had a menu posted with prices included, The prices seemed appealing and I saw that it was crowded so, I decided to go for it, 

As soon as I walked in, I felt a sort of dinginess to the establishment but that was not what bothered me. It was so noisy as there was some sort of sports team having dinner. It was so noisy that even though I was underneath the television, I could hardly hear it nor could I hear myself talking to my other dinner guest. As soon as we came in the door, we noticed a couple empty tables by the flat screen television that was mounted above the last table. We were told to sit there and within two minutes, a menu was dropped at the table. A few minutes later, our order was taken and we were given our two sodas and this was at 6:45, After that interaction, we did not see our waitress until she literally "dropped" the pizza on the table and left which was 45 minutes later. 

For forty five minutes we were not acknowledged or offered any water or a refill of any soda. Granted, she had a party of people but she was circulating the dining room and she took several minutes to relax so, this was no excuse. 

The only time the waitress came by to ask if everything was alright was when she was picking up the bill from the table behind us. She saw our soda glasses were empty and she did not offer any more or even offer us water or more napkins which we could have used. I am a grown boy and I can ask for what I need but when I go out to a restaurant, I should not have to. 

Then after sitting there for a bit, she dropped the check off at the table without asking if we needed anything else. Of course, as we were getting ready to go, the theatrics came on and she was so friendly... I know this game... the insincere sincerity will not cloud the fact that you offered no service and are now expecting a gratuity. In all honesty, she provided some of the worst service I had in a long time and I eat out frequently. 

As far as the food, the pizza was actually quite good. The toppings were plentiful and the cheese was just enough. As far as the crust, it was crispy yet chewy. So, I would give the pizza cook 3 stars for a well made pizza. However, the wait service was extremely poor and neglectful. 

Would I come back here again? In all honesty, if I saw this waitperson were not here, I may give it a try but would I go out of my way to go there just to go? I think not!
author: Tony M.

description:
It's OK.  There were a bunch of loud obnoxious men who were screaming when they weren't even funny blabbering about sports as if it were worth talking about.

Pizza was good.

Beer pretty good.  Giant pitcher for $7.25.  And I mean a BIG pitcher.

They have a TV but it isn't elevated and it is small so unless you sit by the entrance, you can't watch it.

Service fast; reliable.

Pizza pretty good; slightly burnt but not bad.
author: Tony U.

description:
My family and a friend went to this place for dinner, and all of us thought that this was the worst pizza we have had in sf. I know that my opinion does not just come my selective taste buds because everyone in my family was experiencing       diarrhea and nausea after this experience. All the food tasted like it came from either a can or freezer, but the real issue was the cheese -it had a funky smell.
 When we told the lady what was wrong, she said that everything was made from fresh ingredients, though obviously something was wrong. Oh, and also, our water and soda tasted like chlorine. How can someone mess up water! The lady kept on lounging with people who looked like regulars and watched tv, which is totally unacceptable. This place does not deserve 1 star.
author: K Y.

description: I had my first Pizza at Pirros in the 70s and new the owner and saw the sale happen. It was back then the best pizza ever. I tried them from coast to coast and pirros always came out on top. Then about 6 years ago I moved back to the City and started ordering delivery and they just got progressively worse. The final straw was a two hour wait a cold pizza arrived with no apology and it was worthless not even edible and I called to complain and was told to bad. Avoid the smug owners that do not care about customers.
author: Steve B.

description:
sweet lord jesus, this place is awful. admittedly, i checked the yelp reviews before i went and saw some red flags but decided to try it anyway (i thought maybe it's so bad it's good? yeah, i know...). it's awful. and the place smells weird on the inside. as soon as i walked in, i knew i'd made a mistake. 

don't do it. not even out of morbid curiosity.
author: Janet R.

description: Ordered from grub hub, took them 2.5 hours to deliver a hamburger, fries and a medium pizza.  By the time it arrived the hamburger was cold, and missing the cheese.  Only reason they even got 1 star is the pizza was fairly good.  But they will never be ordered from again.  Honestly, go elsewhere.
author: Raquel S.

description:
In all honesty, I haven't been here in a while, but my last experience here was so bad that it will be years before I ever go back.  I ordered a pizza for pickup and waited in the counter area.  The asian girl working the counter knew fully well that I was there and waiting for my order for the longest time.  Well, after almost an hour and a half later (I just knew something was wrong), I found out that my pizza had been ready eons ago.  WTF.  To add insult to injury, I got it home and it tasted terrible because it had been sitting so long.  Never again.

Too bad since this place used to be pretty good years ago.  Like in that movie Pink Panther after Peter Sellers breaks that expensive vase and someone tells him, "sir, that was a priceless antique!"...he replied, "Not anymore!"
author: Roy N.

description:
their toppings are great, the pizzas are fresh, they have beer on tap.

I've only eaten in the resturant once (i always get take out)  but the service was good.

With the limited choices in pizza in outer sunset, pirros is definitly my favorite
author: Michael E.

description:
If you had fond memories of Pirro's in the past, DO NOT COME HERE. Change of ownership has run this place to the dumps.

Actually, just DON'T COME HERE AT ALL.

I REALLY REALLY wanted to like you, Pirro's, I did, but you have so royally fucked up tonight that all my fond childhood memories have been tainted.

The bf and I came here because Eagle's was closed for summer vacation, and it was a HUGE disappointment. I ordered a Ravioli Dinner for $12.75, which was advertised to come with salad, soup, bread, coffee, and dessert. Bf had vegetarian pizza with chicken added. (ironic yes, I guess he liked the vegetable choices)

Food:
I'll start with my Bf's pizza. It'll be short and sweet.
Pizza: Alright. Wasn't amazing, but it was edible

My "Ravioli" Dinner:
Salad: iceberg lettuce mix (from a bag) with olives and Italian dressing and a tomato wedge.
Soup: Minestrone soup from a can.
Bread: Maybe the only redeemable item. 5 slices came hot with some butter.
Ravioli: DO NOT ORDER. They use tiny frozen raviolis. How do I know? The pasta was uncooked.. and the filling was dry. When we brought it to the server's attention, we got no apology, but just asked if we wanted anything else instead. I decided to just get some Spaghetti instead.
Spaghetti: at least the noodles were cooked. Unmemorable. My mom makes better spaghetti sauce that doesn't taste like it came from a can.
Dessert and Coffee: Never got it. She did ask me, but she phrased it in such a way that I thought I had to pay extra. Since it was advertised to come with the meal, I figured she'd just serve me or asked me to choose from a selection. By this time I just wanted to cut my loses and get the hell out.

Service: Service was okay until a softball team of about 15 people came in half way through our meal. I tried to be understandable of the stress the only server would feel, if only she wasn't so rude and at least tried to be polite I would have given her a better tip. I swear she was answering phones, making pizzas, taking orders, and everything on her own. She ignored me and my bf as soon as the large party came in, surprising since our table was literally right next to them.
When we asked for the bill, I was shocked to see that she had the ravioli dinner written down. I went up to tell her I didn't have the ravioli since we sent it back, and she briskly said she charged me for the spaghetti dinner but just didnt change it on the bill. At this point we just wanted to the the hell out, so we paid and left ASAP.

BY THE WAY, PIZZA SAUCE OR SOUP COME'S FROM A CAMPBALL'S CAN. I SAW IT.

Overall: Maybe pizza for pick-up ONLY. Everything else don't bother.
author: Jenna H.

description: Pirro's , used to be a great pizza place maybe 10 years ago, but now , your better off eating frozen pizza, or go to 7-11 and grab a hot and you will be better off. The place stinks of something and its not pizza or any kind of food.
author: Oscar R.

description:
I come to pirro's if I'm craving LOTS of cheese and plenty of mushrooms. 

Note that this place is run by Chinese people.

Crispy crust that is a cross between regular thickness and thin crust pizza. I usually order the pepperoni, sausage and mushroom pizza. 

They do not kid around with cheese here, so be prepared for some stringy awesomeness! And they pile on the toppings like they have too much and don't know what to do with it. I love the amount of mushrooms that they use. They usually slice them thin so they cook all the way, and just go bonkers putting them on the pizza. Great flavor! 

Another note: their XL is most pizza places' large, so be careful when ordering.
author: Melissa C.

description:
So last night after a very draining day a friend of mine and I decided we wanted some pizza - it sounded good and greasy and we were in.  I had passed this place a few times and it looked local and non-chain.  Perfect.

We ordered a large take out, the service was good and fast and our pizza was done in the 20 minutes they told us it would be.  So the large pizza we ordered was a bit on the small size and for about 19 bucks I thought it would be a bit larger.  The pie was cooked to perfection - no burned marks and they got our order right which is always a plus.

Why did I think it was ok?  Well it was just the flavors really.  I loved the crust it was perfect, but the cheese was overpowering with our toppings and the seasonings were a bit on the bland side.  However I would go back again for sure and now that we have a to go menu for delivery this place trumps all the chains for sure.  I would go back for a great pizza.  I didn't order other things on the menu but they did have pastas and some garlic bread I may try on my next visit.  :)
author: Heidi S.

description:
I held my sons birthday party at this place, mostly because it was close to the Gymboree on Sloat..and the only place that had enough seating for 30 adults and 11 kids, all under the age of 5. I enjoyed the food, and the owner was nice enough to have 8 pizzas ready for my large group. I enjoyed not having to worry about cooking for that many people..and the party took up pretty much the whole restaurant so it was nice to have our own private space.

All in all, i enjoyed this place. And, if I'm ever in the neighborhood, I would return for the food.
author: Br.Andi V.

description:
ok this gets a 3 (actually about a 3.5) but only for the pesto pizza (with mushroom and sausage) . This used to be a great pick for any pizza and delivery was good. Recently we decided to try picking up the pizza rather than having it delivered... guess what??? Something happens to that pie from the time they make it to the time it gets to your door.. it's terrific if you pick it up!  Problem is 99.9% of us normal kind of people here want DELIVERY! And don't want a compromised pie to get it! Oh well - its not our "in a pinch pizza" OR the "oh no! drop by company! lets order pizza" type of place. 
Sad to say for delivery you are better off with round table (gasp i said it!).
author: Candy H.

description:
When I was a kid in the 80's, Pirro's was my favorite.  What happened? Ownership change.

Pirro's under the current ownership is the worst place to have pizza in SF.  The owner (see the lady next to the prom queen) is rude, cheap and has run this business into the ground.  The ingredients she uses caused me to have diarrhea on more than one occasion.  I have talked with others that have had the same experience.  A few years back there was an animal that died between the buildings.  She would not take care of it because of the removal cost. 

Avoid this place!!!
author: Kevin B.

description:
Something about the pizza here is better than the average.  It's not as legendary as it used to be and it seems like they've struggled to keep it staffed well but it's a place I frequent for pizza in the Sunset.

It's a plus for big groups - they can accomodate teams easily.

I wouldn't recommend non-pizza items.
author: yohs m.

description:
Doesn't taste like last time (two years ago). Perhaps I'm more finicky in my old age, but it was a little too cheesy. It made the center so soggy, that part of the crust disappeared in the cheese heap.  It took forever for the pizza get to our table, but to their defense, they had two softball teams eating there while we were there.

My GF liked their pizza, but she must be part-mouse...
author: Ezduzit S.

description:
I don't want all my reviews to sound happy-doodle, but I just saw that someone had reviewed this and wanted to add my two cents.

I ran into this place the first night I moved to the city and had to try it... it was local after all.

We ordered the chicken and pesto and were promptly told that it was their most popular pizza. I see why. The pizza was so yummy.The pesto was creamy and they were heavy on the garlic. The crust is crisp on the outside and soft and doughy on the inside, and the chicken was plentiful.

When I brought my folks a week and a half later, they remembered me and my friend and remembered that we ordered the chicken and pesto. And even my parents liked the place... and we know how old people can be

I'll continue to order that exact pizza every time I go there.... and maybe just rub it all over my body while howling at the moon. *cough*
author: Jenn H.

description:
After reading all the reviews about Pirro's.  I have to just say it's OK maybe it's because I had it delivered so it didn't taste as fresh???  I was hungry and really craving pizza so why not try Pirro's?  

1)  The sauce is kind of cardboard tasting.  I don't believe it to be homemade

2)  I was charged a delivery fee (which is fine considering the high cost of gas.  Does the driver get the fee?  I also tipped him $2.85 so I paid an extra almost $6 for my pizza which only cost $11 for a small with one topping.  

3)  They didn't give me any napkins, cheese, or hot pepper flakes

Anyways, to sum it all up, I've had better and probably will not go back to Pirro's.  Although the crust was good, better than a lot of places.
author: Kaitlyn G.

description: A pizza place run by Chinese? What is the world coming to?!? But the Italians need not worry, because this place has a ways to go before it becomes serious competition for all the other pizza joints in town. Not that the pizza itself was terrible, but even Costco's pizza had better flavor, and for half the price.  If it's delicious, aromatic pizza you're looking for, I'd suggest Milano's Pizza on Irving Street. But if you happen to be in the neighborhood and can't find anywhere else to go for pizza, by all means Pirro's Pizza won't kill you. But that's the best I can say about it.
author: Meg P.

description:
I agree with a few other yelpers that the noise level here on a Friday/Saturday night can be a bit...loud.  But the pizza more than makes up for it.  The crust is thin enough but not too thin, plenty of awesome toppings (my favorite is the Pirro's Special...everything!) and done to perfection.  

I've been coming here since I was 5-ish, so maybe its just the nostalgia talking, but this place has amazing pizza and anytime I'm in the neighborhood I always stop by and pick up a pie to go.
author: Kathleen B.

description:
Terrible place.  Do not go there and definitely do not order to go.  

I ordered delivery.  After 1 hour and one-half it was still not delivered - although I live less than a mile away.  Told it was "on its way."  After another 10 minutes, I called back.  Asked if they would adjust price, and was  rudely  told "no".  No apologies, no offer to make up for horrible service.  Nothing.  Complete lack of customer service.  SImply rude.

Place was once great - owned by an Italian family.  No more.  New owners have ruined it.  Inside it is dirty and unsanitary.  Restrooms are absolutely disgusting.   Last time they had no soap - which they never replaced the entire time we were there.  (And yes - they make pizza with their hands. . . not a pretty thought, is it???).   Tables and floor were also filthy.

As other reviewers have noted, entire place is dingy and dark.  So do yourself (and your health) a favor and do not step foot in there.

Pizza has become terrible too.  Which is really too bad - once it was great when it was a family owned Italian restaurant.  New owners seem to be cheap on use of cheese and ingredients.  Like cardboard.  As you will see from reviews, many others agree.  Ridiculously over-priced too.

Fully agree with reviewer that said it is not even worth one star.  

Much better pizza close by is from Paradise in West Portal.  Also Pasquales.
author: k p.

description:
I have a family friend that grew up in the Sunset around Taraval eating lots of Pirro's pizza.  He said that it has changed hands, but it used to be really good when he was growing up some thirty years ago.  This is how I got the recommendation to eat here.

We only ate pizza from Pirro's, so I can't comment on any of their other menu items.  But we really, really enjoyed their pizza.  They deliver, their prices are reasonable, their staff is friendly (the times we went in and ordered), the service is quick, and their ingredients seem fresh.  My only complaints are as follows: we had to ask them to go light on the sauce since they usually go a little heavy handed, and sometimes when we would call, we had trouble getting through or placing the order because the staff member on the other end was hard of hearing or had trouble with English.

I recommend getting take out and asking them to go light on the sauce.  Otherwise, the pizza is tasty and always seems to hit the spot!
author: Heather S.

description:
If there was a negative rating i would literally put a -10. They have the WORST service and food. First of all, i went there with my team becuase we wanted pizza. They took over 3 hours to make 5 pizza, LITERALLY. i kept asking where is my pizza, they say its coming. then i saw them making hte pizza at 2 1/2 mark we have been there. they were very rude and they stuck me nad my team outside in the backyard. the tables we filty and had dirt and leaves on it. they would not even clean the tables for us. then i ask for an extra table and they said you cant have one becuase im busy making piiza for another table. they also gave us paper plates and cups while they gave everyone else inside glass and porceline plates and cups.

The lady working there also yelled at me for asking where my pizza was. they also have flys in hte water they serve you. plus the man making the pizza has a beard and does not wear a mask or covering so i found hair in my pizza. 

what kind of service is this?
author: Brandon I.

description:
Pirro's is the quintessential american family pizzaria.  It is family run and has the red-and-white checkered tableclothes that one can expect from the archetypical american pizza place.  The service is brusque but friendly; it is almost like you are old family friends where empty pleasantries are no longer necessary.

As for the pizza: it is very very good.  The ingredients are fresh and the meats are top notch.  In addition, they consistently bake the pizza to a perfect crust (deliveries don't count).  There is nothing extraordinary about the pizza, but it does the ordinary combination pizza (Pirro's Special) a service well worth talking about.
author: Mark K.

description:
Let me preface this review by saying that I worked in the restaurant business for over 14 years in nearly every capacity from dishwasher to manager.  In this time period one of the most important lessons I learned was how to treat a guest apporpriately to ensure that they would return  

Unfortunately in the case of Pirro's, the waitress, who did a fine job and was quite accommodating, could not compensate for the level of disrespect exhibited by the manager.   Whom I found to be pushy, disrespectful and anything but accommodating, causing my fiance and I to leave before ever taking a bite....
author: Colin F.

description:
I fully agree with most of the reviews below which give Pirro's a terrible review.  One star is really one too many.

Restaurant is simply not clean.  Manager is rude, and service is terrible.

Do not even bother with ordering delivery.  It takes forever.  And pizza arrives cold and not edible.

Place has taken a nose dive since it was owned by different people.

Our softball team went there for years, but no more. Pizza itself is lame, salads are dry and appear to be days old from a bag.   And waaaay over-priced.

Coupled with rude - or non-existent - service, and there is really nothing redeeming to say about the place.
author: john p.

description:
Came here last night with a friend that has been coming here since he was a kid after games.  I enjoyed it very much...pizza was good (just enough crust and not too much grease as others can do), service was spot on and though my friend thought the owner didn't remember him, she placed him as we left and extended her wishes to his father which I thought was extremely nice.
I'm hoping we visit again so I can try other selections on the menu...
author: Ninja H.

description:
The take out pizza is hit or miss-maybe depending on who is cooking that day. A nice family friendly neighborhood place though. Beers on tap. This is not the Marina so don't expect to be waited on hand and foot(whatever that means). This was a place many years ago. Concensus seems to say pickup is more desireable than delivery.
Outdoor seating in the back. Open till 10pm.
author: Mag N.

description:
I thought the pizza was too greasy and had too much cheese....which is rare for me cus I would eat cheese w/almost anything. I use to put a slic of cheese on my bread and microwave it and eat it. I love cheese, but the pizza here drowns in it. Very greasy. Flavoring is whatevers.
I don't want to go back......so I hope my friends don't crave for it for some srange reason.
author: Jenny W.

description:
I've come here a couple of times. Pizza is ok, but not essentially awesome. I've had just the regular stuff. Because this place looks more like a bar than a pizzeria on the outside, and that it's located further down on Taraval, I don't usually see many people go in. On the upside, they do have an outdoor patio, and it seems great for throwing impromptu birthday parties or celebrating whatever. 

I haven't tried delivery, and from the reviews, thank goodness I don't do so. There's plenty of pizza joints in the city, but they're the only ones I know who have an outdoor patio.
author: Clinton L.

description:
My roommate and I decided to try this place after debating which pizza place on Taraval we should go to.  We picked it because it was closer to our house.

We got the Pirro's pizza (I think that's what it's called) which basically has everything on it.  We liked it a lot.  Nice crust, good amount of all the ingredients and good flavor.

I've come here a few times since then and liked it every time.  Not the best place to get a pizza quick if you're pressed for time.  But nothing super fancy.

Good prices, good pizza and they deliver!
author: imelda j.

description:
I'm really picky about pizza and especially sausage pizza and surprisingly Pirro's was able to satisfy my need for a good sausage pie. It's not in my neighborhood; however, when I want pizza from now on I'm going there for sure. 

Certainly one of the better places to get pizza in San Francisco.
author: Michael M.

description: I downed a lot of Pirro's pizza during college so I'm writing a review for nostalgia's sake.  Always ordered the Pirro's Special.  PIzza was good and very filling.  Better than Domino's or Round Table.
author: Wendy H.

description: The coach for my softball team loves this place. The rest of us stand it, but that's about it. Either treat yourself to a Starfleet with jalepeños, or go to The Pizza Place on Noriega
author: Kevin K.

description:
Good local pizza!

Nice place to hang out, within walking distance of where I live though - so I'm biased. I went to school with one of the sons of the owner for many years, so I can definitely vouch for the "family environment". 

There's only one real negative: I'm a crust eater, but I just can't ever eat Pirro's crusts. I don't know why.
author: Karl K.

description:
What an odd place. A cavernous old Italian restaurant, empty except for an elderly woman eating take-out Chinese food, despite the sign at the door that says "No outside food." "Wheel of Fortune" was blaring on the TV. The tables had a few crumbs left over from previous diners. 

Why did we eat here, you ask? We'd walked by earlier in the evening (and on other occasions) and seen many people inside. After an aborted attempt to eat at a different pizza place, we were starving and tired of walking. "Let's just try this place," we said. "It seems to be pretty popular." What could possibly go wrong?

We ordered a small house salad, which was $5.25 for what turned out to be a tiny bowl of iceberg lettuce with one tomato wedge and half a can of sliced black olives dumped on top. Mmm.

"Wheel of Fortune" ended and another show came on. Not sure what it was, though, because the owner turned on some "lite rock" music, without turning off the TV. I love conflicting bad TV and bad music.

Much later, our pizza arrived. It was actually pretty OK pizza -- nice crust, decent sauce -- but we bolted it down as quickly as possible so we could get out of there. The pizza wasn't good enough to bother taking the leftovers home. 

Total: around $30 for two root beers, a medium 2-topping pizza, and the sorriest excuse for a salad I've ever seen. Feh.
author: Val P.

description: the pizza is decent here, but the water and soda kinda tastes funny. I would go here over dominoes or pizza hut but round table is better than this place. I haven't tried the other dishes here but from my preliminary survey of the other customers, its doesn't look too promising. I think they have a backyard for outdoor seating though.
author: Robert Y.

description: Ohhh god. As soon as we got inside we knew it was sketchy. The place was completely empty except an elderly lady who seemed to only speak Cantonese. We had doubts about whether it was open and almost left. Fortunately (unfortunately?) my family is Chinese and we confirmed with the lady that it was indeed open. Then she started yelling PENNY! PENNY-AH! PENNY! for some five minutes, and FINALLY another Chinese lady came out to seat us. We sat down, looked around at the miserable place, and decided to get the hell out of there as soon as the waitress's back was turned. So no, I didn't eat the food, but all my self preservation instincts told me not to. Stay away, folks.
author: Skye L.

description: Great little Pizza Parlor with friendly, accomodating staff and excellent pizza.  Great place to go after softball games for beer and pizza!  Reasonable prices for pitchers of beer.  Hooray Pirro's!
author: Adam D.

description: Pizza is decent, service sucks.  I ordered a pizza for pick up, got there, and they had mistakenly given it to someone else right before I arrived.  On top of that she laughed at her mistake.  She really LOLed.  Since I was already there ordered another one.  I was starving at the time and had to wait an extra 25 mins, which is an eternity for me when I'm that hungry.  I asked for a side of ranch as I was leaving and the lady said $1.  I couldn't believe she was gonna actually charge me for it after giving away my pizza and LOLin.  I said "really"? She said "Oh actually you can have it."
author: Mo D.

description: I used to live in the Sunset for 20 years in the past and I thought it would be great to bring my family to this once great pizzeria. The first clue I should've looked at was nobody was there even when they had the Open sign on. I had to call a number then she showed up, I gave it a chance and was disappointed with the result. The dough was chalky and the toppings were overpriced. Don't even try to add artichokes and anchovies 'cause you'll end up paying an arm and a leg for two medium pizzas cooked in a small oven. I think their main oven is just for show. I used to like Pirro's during the '80s. It's not the same, don't even bother coming here. They should change their name now to Pirates 'cause you'll feel like you've been jacked. Steer clear mateys. Pirro's used to be one my favorites, now I'm never coming back. It's worth the lesson in nostalgia.
author: Dino S.

description: My family used to order from this pizzeria when I was a wee lass. I never really liked it because they were always very heavy-handed with their sauce. On the plus side, their crust is also very bready and thick, so that was quite tasty. Perhaps they have since changed their ways, but I never really liked pizza as a child because of that drowning-in-sauce effect (and still am not a huge fan -- *gasp*), and I really do think Pirro's Pizzeria had something to do with what my family then thought was my finicky taste.
author: Audrey J.

description: I used to enjoy this pizza.  It's mediocre.  Not bad if you order delivery.  However, dining at the actual restaurant is gross.  The place is dingy and just not well kept.  Unfortunately, it's not that kid friendly either.  My family and I have decided on another pizza joint for our family pizza nights.
author: Karen C.

description: You would think at least 1 italian person works here, or someone who represents the word of pizza. I called on the phone and the lady who answered had bad hearing, and yelled,  and didn't bother answering my question because she thought i was wasting her time. The place is rundown both in and out, the workers are actually chinese and speak very little english which makes you worried. The next thing-i went a monday-mondays can be slow a few people came in and out-the place is empty, and they have some TV's on which they do not listen to, and blast out the loudest volume the TV can handle. My friend and I ordered a personal pizza (the ones you usually find at Pizza Hut). Keep in mind we were actually not that hungry but really craving pizza. anyway for 4-5 bitch size slices, the size of your palm the pizza cost $11+. NO TIP was given. The Tip was really that $11 not worth spending. I had much better pizza too. Their menus and tables are dirty. Their bathrooms are icky, and their service is shit. Don't go here.
author: Cody A.

description: The pizza here is OK, not as good as many many other places in the city... but the real downer here is the service. I haven't had the experience of dining in, but I called and ordered a pizza from the owner and she was incredibly rude. I literally live a block away from Pirro's and after over an hour my pizza had not arrived... I called them to see what the status was (not to be rude, but to find out if they had simply missed the building) and she snapped that the driver was on his way and hung up without any more of a conversation.
author: Megan D.

description: In all honesty, I have not been back to this place for a number of years until recently and my experience here was not so good the last time as well as the recent time that I had been here. They only had the manager and one worker at the time but they food rating in my opinion went down.
author: Maile W.

description: I have been eating this pizza since 1972, the Pirros Special, is the pizza I compare all others to. Its a simple traditional pizza, but with loads of flavor and to this day my favorite. The owners have changed but the pizza has not...........Do not be fooled by appearances alone. Again, nothing fancy, just an excellent old school pizza and a staple in the community. The owner is at times, pizzaiolo and delivery driver, so if they should be open but its locked, just give a call or wait 10, she will return.
author: Rick T.

description: People seem to be pretty upset with this place. I can understand, too much cheese (WHAT?!), maybe on the greasy side (hangover cure). But, when you are not a meat eater, you dig the occasional grease and when you only order cheese pies, then too much cheese is fantastic. I have pulled about 30 large cheese out of here in the 6 months I was relegated to the Parkside and after the first one I kept going back. I think the sauce tastes great and the crust is perfect, thin but dense. Super friendly owner who definitely appreciates your business. The best way to enjoy the pizza is definitely fresh in the restaurant. Give it a try, maybe you'll love it and maybe not. I'm a fan.
author: William R.

description: good pizza. plain jane interior. it's been here for a very long time. so if you're in the mood for for a pizza in the foggy sunset, you can't go wrong here. the clams and garlic is tasty and so is the Pirro's Special.
author: Jeff W.

description: Went to Pirro's for the first time this weekend. I live in the neighborhood and was anxious to try something new....that being said, I wish I had stayed home after the horrible experience we had! First of all, we walk in and there was no one in there. The server tried to seat the two of us at a table for at least 10 people. We convinced her to let us sit at the two top near the door...obviously, no one ever sits there because there was a layer of dust on the seats and on the table. Mistake #1 was thinking that we could get good Italian food at a Chinese owned and operated establishment. Mistake #2 was NOT ordering pizza....I ordered a chicken parm sandwich and it was literally a perfectly round breaded frozen chicken patty on a hamburger bun. When I ordered, the server asked me what kind of cheese I wanted on my Chicken Parm sandwich! WHAT?! It's a Chicken Parm sandwich for crying out loud..how about mozzerella cheese?! When it was served, it had the chicken patty and red sauce on one half of the hamburger bun and shredded pizza cheese on the other half. My boyfriend ordered the ravioli with meatballs (which is a weird combo in itself if you ask me!)...He described it as being so chewy that it was like "meat flavored gummy bears"...it was gross! His salad consisted of bagged ice berg lettuce (the white part), sliced olives, and one slice of unripened tomato. This place will forever be known as the meal that all other bad meals are compared to...as in, "this is pretty bad, but not as bad as that meal we had that time at Pirro's Pizza!"....DISGUSTING and overpriced!
author: Elle Marie E.

description:
In the sunset, this place is good.  The lady on the phone sounds kind of abrasive but its better than North Beach, Brother's, cheaper than Round Table, way better than Pasqual's and they deliver.

Only places that I have found better is 19th and Irving and Pizza Place on Noriega.

Good luck
author: Dan M.

description: What self respecting pizzeria serves a CHICKEN PATTY as their chicken parm? I stumbled upon this place because it's super close to my place. The first time, our pizza was burnt and took forever to come out (and we were literally the only ones in there!) However, we were impressed with how cold their Heineken pitchers were, so we decided to give it another chance. Bad decision! Again, we got absolutely no attention from the staff....wait, i mean the ONE lady serving the entire restaurant. It took literally 20 minutes to get our pitcher, and another half hour to get our food. Another burnt small pizza, and a frozen chicken patty for a chicken parm! We had no choice, but to leave them a "tip" of advice "Get some more help, and some REAL chicken".
author: Crystal A.

description: Do you like things that taste bad?  Well if you do then you'll love Pirro's.  Go here only if you don't have taste buds.  Seriously.
author: Chelsea C.

description: I was excited to have a cozy pizza shop so close to my new home. After tonight's dismal service I never want to go back. The waitress was cold and inattentive. Apparently there were a couple of sports teams that were having post-season parties. She managed to seat us right smack in the middle of the little kids and their pizza (we were there first though...so it would have been easy to reseat us or move them). Besides having to yell our conversation at each other and occassionally get bumped into by a munchkin, our water glasses were ignored and our pizza came out burnt. Lame. We felt bad since the kid's parents were aware of our displeasure and apologized for bugging us. Wasn't their fault the people working there don't know how to treat their customers! ugh.
author: Laura R.

description: To be honest, if I were to just grade the pizzas here it would be much higher, possibly a 4. However, the service is just downright bad. I've been there three times, and although my first experience there was great, the last two times the owner rude. In fact, they even called us to say our pizzas were ready and when we arrive, we still had to wait nearly half an hour! So as they say in the yelp world, "meh, I've experienced better".
author: Simon L.

description: I always see people in here, but I'm really not sure why.  I mean it's good food, I just don't really like it very much.  It's really close to me, but I still rarely go.  The environment is a nice family style pizzeria place but the food is average and the prices seemed kinda high for the quality of the food.  I haven't had the best service here either, not totally bad service, but they do lag.  It seems like a pretty decent place to go if you have kids, but I don't have kids so I don't like it.
author: Tara B.

description: Pirro's Pizza isn't too bad if you're up for relatively moderate priced pizza. But there are so many other places around the city and even some that are close-by. But they are family run, so that makes me feel a little less guilty of eating pizza. But I recommend it.
author: Michael C.

description: Pizza was decent, albeit on the greasy side of things, which is not a personal preference.  However, overall a solid place with decent service.
author: Meiling W.

description: im giving them one star, because zero stars is not an option. WHAT A HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT!!!!!!! i used to eat here all the time about 10 years ago... when i lived closer to it. today it is SO disgusting! the minestrone soup was SOUR! it was so gross!!!! the sour flavor was so extreme, im convinced vinegar is what the broth is made of. the service was awful, very slow and they cant even work the register. its ridiculous. the pizza is only good if you like yours soggy. BLECH! and seriously, what kind of pizzeria only uses canned pre-minced garlic instead of actual fresh REAL tasting garlic? GROSS GROSS GROSS!!!!!!!!!
author: Raye T.

description: Pirro's gets such a high review because its a staple of the sunset. I remember the cooks giving us dough to play with while we waited for our pies. Its good, cheesy and they just pile stuff on. I love Pirros. My best friend and his cousin even have T shirts!
author: Mark G.

description: Had the Pirro's special today. It was delicious! I used to go there all the time when I was in high school. The quality hasn't changed.
author: Alton Y.

description: Totally underappreciated neighborhood haven.  Why on earth this place isn't the hot spot of the sunset is beyond me, but I love it.  Sure, they aren't exactly panting on your plate to check on you every 5 minutes, but get a pitcher and settle in for some privacy and absolutely delicious food.
author: Wendy W.

description:
Dear Yelp Family, 
Please don't even bother.  You would rather be hungry.  Why?
Terrible customer service-Not once but twice I asked the heavy-set  Asian hostess/manager "How are you?" &  "How is your day going?"  Both were answered with a very short "Fine"
Not another soul in the restuarant.
Ordered the ravioli and spagetti combo with salad and soup.
The salad was old iceburg lettice with 1/2 a tomato.  Watered down oil and vinager dressing.
The soup tasted like cabbage and salt and it was luke warm.
Once those items were removed the food was then brough 18 minutes later.  Not once did any waiter stop by to say "Coming right up" etc.
Then the food came.  Hardly any sauce.  I asked for some more and looked at my watch.  It came 10 minutes later.  I was half way done by then.
The ravioli was definatly frozen as they were cold in the middle.
The meat balls tasted like they had been put on a grill.
The cheese cake was outsourced.

I used to love this place.  This dish was always a home run.
I would not encourage ANYONE to go to this place now.
Even the bathroom was pathetic.

I should have known better with NO ONE in the place.  
They did have a few walk in orders, but for the most part, nothing going on.  Even as we were waiting on our food, the pizza makers were watching TV and could care less that there were customers in the restuarants.
And the bill came to $42 with 2 glasses of wine and a soda.
Don't even bother.  They won't be open in a year anyway.  What a shame.
I had to give it a one star to get it to post but that is way to kind.

Your Milage May Very...
author: Joe b.

description: 1 star for a decent combo pizza and warm bread.  However, atmosphere is dark and dreary; salad could have come from a bag; dressing out of a bottle; and the service, to say it was bad would be generous... on the night we went, the place was empty, but the server was clueless and it still took an hour to get our food.  Will never return!
author: Bentley L.

description: OK, here's my take on this place. It's a neighborhood dive that has cheap pitchers of Fat Tire and decently tasty brick oven pizza. It's 2 blocks from my house, and is comfortable to walk over and meet friends. It's never crowded, and unlike other reviewers, the TV has never been on loud. The service can be so bad it's hilarious, but other times just fine, I guess it depends on who's working. There is a small patio out back if it's ever warm enough for that. I wouldn't even think of ordering non-pizza items (except a little salad) in a pizza place like this. Just a neighborhood pizza place if you're in the area.
author: L J.

description: Pizza has been wonderful here, definitely try the Pirro's Special. There are tons of toppings on top, plus it's served hot with the crust slightly crisped perfectly on the bottom. Great neighborhood joint!
author: Becky H.

description: this place is horrible, if you like pizza... if you don't know what pizza tastes like then it wont matter if you eat here. the service is bad, the lady/ owner might smile at you and say hi, but 5 workers will stand in the kitchen and talk instead of making your food. i spent 10 bucks on spaghetti,, worst mistake of my life, there was no flavor, no MEATBALLS, i should have just made my own spaghetti at home.  go eat somewhere else! trust me.
author: Ashley M.

description: The service is absolutely disappointing.  Once, they called us to pick up a pizza that wasn't even ready.  We then waited nearly half an hour for the pizza to be ready.  They've also changed the order without asking us first.  But the worst part is that the woman at the cashier can be downright rude.   As for the food,  the pizza is ok (but it's pretty hard to mess up pizza) but the garlic bread tastes totally fake.
author: Raz R.

description:
they don't deserve even one star. 

i ordered a quart of half ravioli and half spaghetti. i was told that my order would be ready in about 10 minutes. went to 711, spent well over 10 minutes there, decided it was time to head over to pick up my food only to find that they did not even start making it. alright fine,  another 10 minutes i was told. 20 minutes passed, made a second attempt to pick up my dinner and to my surprise, it was done. (about time!) 

got in the car, opened the box and was disappointed, shocked, more so disgusted. the portions have gotten so much smaller than what i remembered. i thought maybe, just maybe, the food itself would make up for it, but boy was i wrong. 

half the raviolis were undercooked, STILL FROZEN! the other half were overcooked and were tough to get into. clearly, the raviolis were not fresh and could have been bought for a third of the price at Safeway. enough said. 

oh, & the spaghetti? same deal. definitely not coming back again.
author: Jane Y.
